title: Region bounded by SQRTx and y=6-x

content.question:
The functions f and g are given by <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mi>f</mi> <mrow> <mo>(</mo> <mi>x</mi> <mo>)</mo> </mrow> <mo>=</mo> <msqrt> <mi>x</mi> </msqrt> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3BE1@</annotation> </semantics> </math> and g(x) = 6 - x. Let R be the region bounded by the x-axis and the graphs of f and g, as shown in the figure above. 

(a) Find the area of R.

frqParts.text:
The functions f and g are given by <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mi>f</mi> <mrow> <mo>(</mo> <mi>x</mi> <mo>)</mo> </mrow> <mo>=</mo> <msqrt> <mi>x</mi> </msqrt> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3BE1@</annotation> </semantics> </math> and g(x) = 6 - x. Let R be the region bounded by the x-axis and the graphs of f and g, as shown in the figure above. 

(a) Find the area of R.

(b) The region R is the base of a solid. For each y , where <math> <mrow> <mn> 0  </mn> <mo> ≤  </mo> <mi> y   </mi> <mo> ≤  </mo> <mn> 2 </mn> </mrow> </math> , the cross section of the solid taken perpendicular to the y -axis is a rectangle whose base lies in R and whose height is 2 y . Write, but do not evaluate, an integral expression that gives the volume of the solid.
(c) There is a point P on the graph of f at which the line tangent to the graph of f is perpendicular to the graph of g. Find the coordinates of point P.

topic.text: 2.2: Defining the Derivative of a Function and Using Derivative Notation

skill.text: Skill 1.D: Identify an appropriate mathematical rule or procedure based on the relationship between concepts (e.g., rate of change and accumulation) or processes (e.g., differentiation and its inverse process, anti-differentiation) to solve problems.
